case_title: Major MUHAMMAD ARIF through Abdur Rehman, Special Attorney vs Sardar BAHADUR KHAN and another
appellant: Major MUHAMMAD ARIF through Abdur Rehman, Special Attorney
legal_issues: Violation of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973
key_arguments_appellant: Respondent was not authorized to correspond directly with Army personnel.
Only the Judge Family Court could verify the contents of the letter dated 16-5-1996.
Respondent violated provisions of Soldiers Litigation Act, 1925 and Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973.
key_arguments_respondent: Respondent acted on behalf of his client Mst. Shagufta.
Letter placed on file became a public document.
Respondent disclosed his identity as an advocate while seeking verification.

legal_references.act: Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Act, 1973

judgment_summary: Respondent disclosed his identity as an advocate while corresponding.
No jural relationship existed between complainant and respondent.
Respondent acted diligently on behalf of his client.
Case not hit by Rule 173 of Legal Practitioners and Bar Councils Rules, 1976.
Appeal dismissed, parties to bear their own costs.
